name: URL to Data Loader
description: Downloads a file from a URL and converts into a Data object using the same mechanism as the File component. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
import requests
import base64
import os
import tempfile
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, DictInput

class URLFileLoader(Component):
    display_name = "URL to Data Loader"
    description = "Downloads a file from a URL and converts into a Data object using the same mechanism as the File component."
    icon = "file-text"
    name = "URLFileLoader"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="url", display_name="URL to Fetch", required=True, placeholder="Enter file URL here..."),
        MessageTextInput(name="filename", display_name="Filename", required=True, placeholder="Enter filename with extension..."),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="metadata",
            display_name="Additional Metadata",
            info="Metadata to add to the Data object",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="download_and_process_file"),
    ]

    def download_file_from_url(self, url: str) -> bytes:
        try:
            # Fetch the content from the URL
            response = requests.get(url)
            response.raise_for_status()  # Raise an error for bad responses (e.g., 404, 500)
            return response.content  # Return file content as bytes
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            raise ValueError(f"Error fetching URL: {str(e)}")
    
    def download_and_process_file(self) -> Data:
        # Get URL and filename from inputs
        url = self.url
        filename_val = self.filename
        
        # Download the file content from the URL
        file_content = self.download_file_from_url(url)

        # Create a temporary directory to store the file
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tmpdirname:
            temp_file_path = os.path.join(tmpdirname, filename_val)

            # Write downloaded content to a temporary file
            with open(temp_file_path, 'wb') as temp_file:
                temp_file.write(file_content)

            # Use the existing utility to parse the text file to Data
            try:
                data = parse_text_file_to_data(temp_file_path,silent_errors=self.silent_errors)
            except Exception as e:
                raise ValueError(f"Failed to parse the file: {str(e)}")

            # Ensure file is deleted after processing if required
            os.remove(temp_file_path)
            
            # Determine the source: use 'source' from metadata if it exists, otherwise use self.url
            metadata_source = self.metadata.get("source", self.url)
    
            # Merge metadata, ensuring 'source' uses metadata's value if it exists
            merged_metadata = {**self.metadata, 'source': metadata_source}
    
            # Create a new Data object with the updated source and merged metadata
            return_data = Data(
                text=data.text, 
                filename=self.filename, 
                **merged_metadata  # Add all the additional metadata
            )

            self.status = return_data
            return return_data

import requests
import base64
import os
import tempfile
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, DictInput

class URLFileLoader(Component):
    display_name = "URL to Data Loader"
    description = "Downloads a file from a URL and converts into a Data object using the same mechanism as the File component."
    icon = "file-text"
    name = "URLFileLoader"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="url", display_name="URL to Fetch", required=True, placeholder="Enter file URL here..."),
        MessageTextInput(name="filename", display_name="Filename", required=True, placeholder="Enter filename with extension..."),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="metadata",
            display_name="Additional Metadata",
            info="Metadata to add to the Data object",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="download_and_process_file"),
    ]

    def download_file_from_url(self, url: str) -> bytes:
        try:
            # Fetch the content from the URL
            response = requests.get(url)
            response.raise_for_status()  # Raise an error for bad responses (e.g., 404, 500)
            return response.content  # Return file content as bytes
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            raise ValueError(f"Error fetching URL: {str(e)}")
    
    def download_and_process_file(self) -> Data:
        # Get URL and filename from inputs
        url = self.url
        filename_val = self.filename
        
        # Download the file content from the URL
        file_content = self.download_file_from_url(url)

        # Create a temporary directory to store the file
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tmpdirname:
            temp_file_path = os.path.join(tmpdirname, filename_val)

            # Write downloaded content to a temporary file
            with open(temp_file_path, 'wb') as temp_file:
                temp_file.write(file_content)

            # Use the existing utility to parse the text file to Data
            try:
                data = parse_text_file_to_data(temp_file_path,silent_errors=self.silent_errors)
            except Exception as e:
                raise ValueError(f"Failed to parse the file: {str(e)}")

            # Ensure file is deleted after processing if required
            os.remove(temp_file_path)
            
            # Determine the source: use 'source' from metadata if it exists, otherwise use self.url
            metadata_source = self.metadata.get("source", self.url)
    
            # Merge metadata, ensuring 'source' uses metadata's value if it exists
            merged_metadata = {**self.metadata, 'source': metadata_source}
    
            # Create a new Data object with the updated source and merged metadata
            return_data = Data(
                text=data.text, 
                filename=self.filename, 
                **merged_metadata  # Add all the additional metadata
            )

            self.status = return_data
            return return_data
